chapter.title: Format Correctness
chapter.para: The correctness of formats cannot be evaluated at compile-time. In fact, no format can be checked completely at compile-time because the final appearance on paper or on the screen must be checked by a human in each case.
It is possible to check the correctness of formats at run-time thanks to preconditions:

listitem.para: about the syntactical correctness of the format string.
about the relation between the format string and the other parameters.

chapter.para: Therefore, the approach is not completely unsafe. Part of the class declaration is a set of routines that check the format string and parameters.
